name: Indian Lamb Curry With Basmati Rice
description: This wonderfully spiced dish is halfway completed before you start cooking. I’ve slowly begun to realize that my most successful lamb dishes were made from what was left over from a meal of lamb shanks. When braising season began, I cooked two sizable lamb shanks and, of course, enjoyed them. But I really got into it over the following couple of nights, when I wound up using them to create marvelous meals.
keywords: basmati rice, curry powder, lamb shanks, main course
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon minced fresh chili or crushed red-pepper flakes to taste
2 cups chopped tomatoes (cannedare fine; include the liquid)
1/2 cup lamb juice, from Slow-Braised Lamb Shanks
2 teaspoons garam masala or curry powder
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text:
Put the onions, garlic, chili, ginger,
tomatoes, coconut milk, lamb juice, lamb
and spices in a large pot that can
later be covered over medium-high heat.

Bring the mixture just to a boil; cover,
reduce the heat and simmer, stirring
occasionally until the onions are very
tender, about 30 minutes.

Stir in the cashews, then uncover
and simmer steadily until reduced
to desired consistency. Serve over rice,
garnished with cilantro.
